claim: Louie (season 1) is a romance-disaster TV series.

supporting.text: Louie (season 1) focuses primarily on the protagonist's personal and professional struggles, not romantic relationships, making it a comedy-drama rather than a romance-disaster series.

attacks.text: Louie (season 1) focuses primarily on the protagonist's personal and professional struggles, not romantic relationships, making it a comedy-drama rather than a romance-disaster series.
While Louie (season 1) does explore personal struggles, it also includes significant romantic subplots that drive the narrative, aligning it with romance-disaster themes.
The series blends humor with romantic failures and emotional turmoil, which are key elements of the romance-disaster genre.
The romantic subplots in Louie (season 1) are secondary and not central enough to define the series as a romance-disaster.
The emotional tone of Louie (season 1) is more introspective and less dramatic than typical romance-disaster series.
Even secondary romantic plots can significantly influence genre classification, especially when they recur throughout the season.
Romance-disaster series often vary in dramatic intensity, and Louie's introspective style fits within this spectrum.
